column4: can I easily switch between GNOME and KDE when both of them are installed?
how did you obtain google earth?
bad idea. i'd rather use the package in Medibuntu.
still, don't use the bot in the channel if you just need to look up information for yourself.
err, and who told you to use the drivers from ati.com? we support what is in the repos.
you didn't left me to type what's left, I want to rollback to the repos' drivers
well, that might not necessarily be easy to achieve.
can you generally give me an advice?
well, uninstall the ati.com one (i hope they come with instructions!), and then install xorg-driver-fglrx
there is #test, there is the command /PING server (to be done in the server window), you can /cs help...
yes, you can. right click on the panel, add applet, it's called menu or something.
I didn't get you, I was trying to say that I have the applications, places and system launchers, and I want them in one
yes, i think there is an alternative applet you can use that doesn't have those three menus. i don't remember how it's called, as i'm not a GNOME user.
